Posts.Content: Have my 1.5 year old restling with my lap top here so will have to be short.  I had chemo for oesophageal cancer (it has a really low survival rate) 6 years ago. I was nervous of getting the treatment but I could not swallow so I needed it and I instantly saw results. I had 4 consecutive days of chemo a month for 3 months which included taxotere.  I used to joke taxotere loose your hair.  I was suprisingly upset when the hair went, my then fiance (we married 2 weeks after chemo) was trying to hide it from me but it was a shock but at least I knew that the chemo was working and I was stronger than the cancer. I had one good week where I did things (such as plan my wedding).  I remember a lot of things but I do not remember the chemo. You will be fine, it is scary but you need it to have a long life. Better get back to my 18 month and 31 month old who are running riot! Aoife
Posts.Title: Petrified of getting chemo

Posts.Content: All that I can say is that it does change you - I am a 5 year oesophageal cancer survivor and being diagnosed made me realise what is important - in my case I married my long term love and have a son and daughter with him now.  I am sorry that you are going through this.
Posts.Title: My Wife left me after Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I don't know the answers sorry - I would not give up on her but that is just me.
Posts.Title: My Wife left me after Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I had it for something else - I used to joke 'taxotere, loose your hair'.  I had it with other chemo so can not tell if it was bad in particular plus I forget most of it.
Posts.Title: Taxotere?
